Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute. — Abelson & Sussman
The best error message is the one that never shows up. — Thomas Fuchs
Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad. — Cory House
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code. — John Johnson
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand. — Martin Fowler
Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes. — Oscar Wilde
The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language. — Alan Kay
Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable. — Ralph Johnson
Talk is cheap. Show me the code. — Linus Torvalds
Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability. — Edsger Dijkstra
Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming. — Brian Kernighan
Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. — Brian Kernighan
If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy. — Donald Knuth
Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen. — Edward V. Berard
Simplicity is the soul of efficiency. — Austin Freeman
Good code is its own best documentation. — Steve McConnell
Fix the cause, not the symptom. — Steve Maguire
A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street. — Doug Linder
The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user. — C.A.R. Hoare
Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out. — Chris Pine
Make it work, make it right, make it fast. — Kent Beck
The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state. — John Ousterhout
Programs are built to be used, not to be read. — Sam Newman
There are only two kinds of programming languages: those people always complain about and those nobody uses. — Bjarne Stroustrup
Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container. — Nathan Myhrvold
A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing. — Alan Perlis
Simplicity is hard work. But there’s a huge payoff. — Rich Hickey
To iterate is human, to recurse divine. — L. Peter Deutsch
The key to performance is elegance, not battalions of special cases. — Jon Bentley
When in doubt, leave it out. — Joshua Bloch
The best way to predict the future is to invent it. — Alan Kay
Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering. — Bill Gates
The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it. — Pamela Zave
A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good. — Martin LeBlanc
Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works. — Steve Jobs
Programs must be efficient in the small and correct in the large. — C.A.R. Hoare
Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve — until they actually did it. — Patrick McKenzie
Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature. — Rich Kulawiec
The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late. — Seymour Cray
If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in. — Edsger Dijkstra
Good software, like wine, takes time. — Joel Spolsky
Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships. — Linus Torvalds
Documentation is a love letter you write to your future self. — Damian Conway
When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code. — Richard Pattis
The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit. — Anonymous
The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it. — Dennis Ritchie
Machines take me by surprise with great frequency. — Alan Turing
Beware of bugs in the above code; I have only proved it correct, not tried it. — Donald Knuth
Software is like entropy: it is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases. — Norman Augustine
Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning. — Anonymous
You can’t have great software without a great team. — Fred Brooks
The best code is no code at all. — Jeff Atwood
A good programmer is not someone who knows every language but someone who can solve problems. — Anonymous
A primary cause of complexity is that software vendors uncritically adopt almost any feature that users want. — Niklaus Wirth
First, do it. Then do it right. Then do it better. — Addy Osmani
The goal of software engineering is to build something that lasts. — Bjarne Stroustrup
Refactoring is like cleaning your room — if you do it always, it’s easy. If you leave it for months, it's a nightmare. — Anonymous
Software is never finished, only abandoned. — David Heinemeier Hansson
Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow. — Anonymous
One man’s crappy software is another man’s full-time job. — Jessica Gaston
Good design adds value faster than it adds cost. — Thomas Gale
Simplicity carried to the extreme becomes elegance. — Jon Franklin
A program is never less clear than when it’s written by someone who doesn’t understand the problem. — Anonymous
The best architects build for change. — Martin Fowler
The simplest thing that could possibly work. — Kent Beck
Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding. — Burt Rutan
The limits of my language mean the limits of my world. — Ludwig Wittgenstein
If you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture. — Brian Foote
In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they’re not. — Yogi Berra
Simplicity is not the absence of complexity; it is the mastery of it. — Anonymous
If you don’t know how to test it, you probably don’t understand it. — Anonymous
Small minds are concerned with the extraordinary, great minds with the ordinary. — Blaise Pascal
A great developer builds for tomorrow, not just today. — Anonymous
Make things as simple as possible, but not simpler. — Albert Einstein
The biggest issue on software teams is making sure everyone understands what everyone else is doing. — Ken Schwaber
Clever code is rarely clear code. — Anonymous
Don’t comment bad code — rewrite it. — Brian Kernighan
Testing proves the presence of bugs, not their absence. — Edsger Dijkstra
You can’t solve a problem on the same level it was created. — Albert Einstein
Fast code is not always good code, but good code is almost always fast. — Anonymous
The purpose of abstraction is not to be vague, but to create a new semantic level. — Edsger Dijkstra
If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough. — Albert Einstein
Optimization hinders evolution. — Alan Perlis
If the code and the comments disagree, both are probably wrong. — Norm Schryer
Programs don’t fail; programmers do. — Anonymous
A program that has not been tested does not work. — Bjarne Stroustrup
The cleaner the code, the fewer the bugs. — Anonymous
Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler. — Albert Einstein
Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares. — Michael Feathers
Move fast and break things. — Mark Zuckerberg
The future of coding is no coding at all. — Chris Wanstrath
Frontend is the art; backend is the engine. — Anonymous
A poor design with great code is still a poor design. — Anonymous
Quality is free, but only to those who are willing to pay for it. — Philip Crosby
Engineering is the art of making what you want from things you can get. — Jerry Avins
If it works, ship it. If it doesn’t, fix it. — Anonymous
Every line of code is a liability. — Uncle Bob
Clear code is kind code — kind to your future self and your team. — Anonymous
